data.title: What Brittany Murphy's Life Looked Like Before Her Tragic Death
data.meta_description: On December 20, 2009, fans across the world were sent reeling with the news of Brittany Murphy's death. The young, vibrant actress was only 32 years old. data.text:
On December 20, 2009, fanatics internationally had been sent reeling with the news of Brittany Murphy's death. The younger, vibrant actress was best 32 years previous. Things started to grow to be much more troubling when the news surrounding her cause of death started to make its approach to the headlines. The autopsy revealed that she had died from complications caused by pneumonia, as well as a cocktail of prescription and over the counter medicines that she had fed on. There were no illegal drugs present in her machine. The questions surrounding her mysterious death began mounting, and the details surrounding her tragic ultimate days started to floor.

10 Brittany Murphy's House Was In Complete Disarray

When most people think of their favorite celebrities, a life of glitz and glamour is the very first thing that involves mind. Sadly, Brittany Murphy's ultimate moments were not spent in the lap of luxury at all. Murphy turned into dwelling in a sprawling 10,000 square foot mansion, but it was filled with garments and packing containers and become in a state of total disarray. Those who attended the scene described what they witnessed as being the home of a hoarder.

RELATED: Brittany Murphy's Greatest Roles, Ranked By IMDb

9 Brittany Murphy's Physical Appearance Was Alarmingly Frail

Even extra troubling become the fact that Murphy had obviously been unwell for quite some time before she passed away. Her make-up artist, Trista Jordan, has come forward to expose that while she become working on set with Brittany on her last film, she was shocked by how frail she was. "Her eyes were so sunken, and she just seemed so sad," says Jordan. âââââ

8 Brittany Murphy Could Barely Stand On Her Own

In an alarming file released by way of Jordan, it turned into also revealed that Murphy become so vulnerable that she couldn't even stand up on her own. She became visibly suffering to hold herself together. Jordan says, "She wasn't herself. She was in so much pain. She had Bambi legs and couldn't stand up."

7 Brittany Murphy's Pre-Existing Health Conditions

During her final days, as Brittany Murphy struggled with pneumonia, she changed into also trying to set up pre-existing health conditions as smartly. Murphy had suffered from a heart murmur and changed into significantly anemic and is alleged to were trying to organize the ones conditions along with the onset of her pneumonia symptoms.

RELATED: Britney Spears Causes Mass Speculation After Expressing Interest In Brittany Murphy's Death

6 She Was Surrounded By Filth

It wasn't just Brittany Murphy's space that changed into a mess, her actual mattress was described as being incredibly grimy. According to Bryn Curt, the author of "Brittany Murphy Files," Brittany's bedside became alarmingly filthy. He says, "She was surrounded by a mountain of clothes, make-up, perfumes, an oxygen machine and medical supplies â¦ It was a ready-made drugstore.The large bed was stained, and the sheets twisted and drenched in sweat. Flanking each side of the bed were nightstands covered in â¦ Half-drunk bottles of water, prescription medication bottles, some open and some empty, and used tissues.â

5 Brittany Murphy Was Quite Ill From Pneumonia

Mere days before her death, Brittany Murphy's health was starting to fail. She wasn't just sick, she was gravely ill and was struggling with serious pneumonia symptoms. She was finding it difficult to breathe, which led to several questions about why her husband didn't rush her to a doctor for professional medical care. In February 2010, the L.A. County Coroner Asst. Chief Ed Winter confirmed she may still be alive today, had she gone to see a doctor to treat her pneumonia.

4 Simon Monjack Had Taken Full Control Of Brittany Murphy's Life

Simon Monjack and Brittany Murphy married in 2007, in spite of heavy warnings from Murphy's loved ones. His criminal past was concerning to them, but Brittany was dedicated to pushing forward with her wedding.

Shortly before her death, it was reported that Monjack had isolated Murphy from her friends, had disconnected her phone lines and was in full control of all aspects of her life. At the time of her death, he was acting as her manager, agent, and sometimes even as her makeup artist.

RELATED: 'What Happened, Brittany Murphy?': The Most Disturbing Details

3 Brittany Murphy's Career Was Falling Apart

Brittany Murphy's career was spiraling out of control just before her death. She was dropped from the sequel to the kids' movie Happy Feet, and her character was cut from Jason Statham's film The Expendables as well. She was also dropped from Disney's 2008 Tinker Bell film. Something wasn't quite right with Murphy, and the world of film was no longer able to take a chance on her.

2 She Was Heavily Medicated

Brittany Murphy clearly recognized there was something wrong with her failing health. Before her death, she used a fake name to speak to a doctor and was able to obtain pharmaceutical products. Her autopsy also revealed a cocktail of medications that she was taking to treat her symptoms. Murphy was taking "antidepressants, antibiotics, migraine capsules, cough medicine, and beta blockers" just before she died.

1 Brittany Murphy Had A Feeling She Was Going To Die

Tragically, Brittany Murphy had a sense of awareness that her health was not going to rebound, with reports indicating that she declared her upcoming death to her own mom.The day she died, Murphy had reportedly felt so ill and so weak that she turned to her mother and said, "I'm death. I'm going to die. Mommy, I like you." It is alleged that her mother proceeded to make her tea, but there was no call made for medical intervention at that time.
